title: Awesome List Updates on Mar 02, 2022

items.title: Awesome Python Typing
items.content_text:
### Tools / Helper tools to add annotations to existing code

*   [autotyping (‚≠ê261)](https://github.com/JelleZijlstra/autotyping) - Automatically add simple return type annotations for functions (bool, None, Optional).
items.content_html:
Tools / Helper tools to add annotations to existing code

  • autotyping (‚≠ê261) - Automatically add simple return type annotations for functions (bool, None, Optional).

items.title: Awesome Cl
items.content_text:
### Web frameworks / Clack plugins

*   [radiance (‚≠ê338)](https://github.com/Shirakumo/radiance) - A web application environment and framework . [zlib](https://directory.fsf.org/wiki/License:Zlib).
*   üëç [Snooze (‚≠ê217)](https://github.com/joaotavora/snooze) - A RESTful web framework. Web server agnostic. Currently has support for Hunchentoot and Clack. Routes are just functions and HTTP conditions are just Lisp conditions. [LLGPL](http://opensource.franz.com/preamble.html).

### Developer utilities / Third-party APIs

*   [journal (‚≠ê42)](https://github.com/melisgl/journal) - a library for logging, tracing, record-and-replay testing and persistence. MIT.
items.content_html:
Web frameworks / Clack plugins

  • radiance (‚≠ê338) - A web application environment and framework . zlib.
  • üëç Snooze (‚≠ê217) - A RESTful web framework. Web server agnostic. Currently has support for Hunchentoot and Clack. Routes are just functions and HTTP conditions are just Lisp conditions. LLGPL.

Developer utilities / Third-party APIs

  • journal (‚≠ê42) - a library for logging, tracing, record-and-replay testing and persistence. MIT.

items.title: Awesome Go
items.content_text:
### Database Schema Migration

*   [godfish (‚≠ê8)](https://github.com/rafaelespinoza/godfish) - Database migration manager, works with native query language. Support for cassandra, mysql, postgres, sqlite3.
items.content_html:
Database Schema Migration

  • godfish (‚≠ê8) - Database migration manager, works with native query language. Support for cassandra, mysql, postgres, sqlite3.

items.title: Awesome Privacy
items.content_text:
### Dating Apps

*   Grindr
*   Badoo
*   Lovoo
*   [Alovoa](https://alovoa.com/) - Free and open-source dating platform that respects your privacy.

### Android

*   [Œµxodus](https://reports.exodus-privacy.eu.org/en/) - The privacy audit platform for Android applications. Find how many trackers your apps have.
    *   [ClassyShark3xodus](https://f-droid.org/en/packages/com.oF2pks.classyshark3xodus/) - Checks apk(s) for known trackers (provided by Exodus) +other warnings and specs.
*   [Plexus](https://plexus.techlore.tech/) - Remove the fear of Android app compatibility on de-Googled devices. Find if an app will work on a De-Googled device.
*   [Netguard](https://netguard.me/) - A simple way to block access to the internet per application.
items.content_html:
Dating Apps

  • Grindr
  • Badoo
  • Lovoo
  • Alovoa - Free and open-source dating platform that respects your privacy.

Android

  • Œµxodus - The privacy audit platform for Android applications. Find how many trackers your apps have.
    • ClassyShark3xodus - Checks apk(s) for known trackers (provided by Exodus) +other warnings and specs.
  • Plexus - Remove the fear of Android app compatibility on de-Googled devices. Find if an app will work on a De-Googled device.
  • Netguard - A simple way to block access to the internet per application.

items.title: Awesome Neovim

items.content_html:
Preconfigured Configuration / Diagnostics

items.title: Awesome Digital History
items.content_text:
### Archives and primary sources / Global

*   [Mementoweb](http://timetravel.mementoweb.org/) - Find archived web pages in Internet Archive, Archive-It, British Library, archive.today, and GitHub.

### Archives and primary sources / Switzerland

*   [chgov](https://www.chgov.bar.admin.ch/) - Minutes of the Federal Council (1848-1963).
items.content_html:
Archives and primary sources / Global

  • Mementoweb - Find archived web pages in Internet Archive, Archive-It, British Library, archive.today, and GitHub.

Archives and primary sources / Switzerland

  • chgov - Minutes of the Federal Council (1848-1963).

items.title: Awesome Nodejs
items.content_text:
### Packages / Mad science

*   [webtorrent (‚≠ê30k)](https://github.com/webtorrent/webtorrent) - Streaming torrent client for Node.js and the browser.
*   [PDFKit (‚≠ê10k)](https://github.com/foliojs/pdfkit) - PDF generation library.
*   [xlsx (‚≠ê36k)](https://github.com/SheetJS/sheetjs) - Pure JS Excel spreadsheet reader and writer.

### Packages / Command-line apps

*   [http-server (‚≠ê14k)](https://github.com/http-party/http-server) - Simple, zero-config command-line HTTP server.
*   [pen (‚≠ê327)](https://github.com/hatashiro/pen) - Live Markdown preview in the browser from your favorite editor.
*   [trymodule (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/victorb/trymodule) - Try out npm packages in the terminal.
*   [themer (‚≠ê5.7k)](https://github.com/themerdev/themer) - Generate themes for your editor, terminal, wallpaper, Slack, and more.
*   [taskbook (‚≠ê9.1k)](https://github.com/klaussinani/taskbook) - Tasks, boards & notes for the command-line habitat.

### Packages / Functional programming

*   [immutable (‚≠ê33k)](https://github.com/immutable-js/immutable-js) - Immutable data collections.

### Packages / HTTP

*   [node-fetch (‚≠ê8.8k)](https://github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch) - `window.fetch` for Node.js.
*   [axios (‚≠ê107k)](https://github.com/axios/axios) - Promise based HTTP client (works in the browser too).

### Packages / Debugging / Profiling

*   [debug (‚≠ê11k)](https://github.com/debug-js/debug) - Tiny debugging utility.

### Packages / Logging

*   [consola (‚≠ê6.7k)](https://github.com/unjs/consola) - Console logger.

### Packages / Command-line utilities

*   [progress (‚≠ê3k)](https://github.com/visionmedia/node-progress) - Flexible ascii progress bar.

### Packages / Build tools

*   [pkg (‚≠ê24k)](https://github.com/vercel/pkg) - Package your Node.js project into an executable.

### Packages / Hardware

*   [serialport (‚≠ê5.9k)](https://github.com/serialport/node-serialport) - Access serial ports for reading and writing.
*   [usb (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/node-usb/node-usb) - USB library.

### Packages / Templating

*   [handlebars.js (‚≠ê18k)](https://github.com/handlebars-lang/handlebars.js) - Superset of Mustache templates which adds powerful features like helpers and more advanced blocks.

### Packages / Web frameworks

*   [Next.js (‚≠ê133k)](https://github.com/vercel/next.js) - Minimalistic framework for server-rendered universal JavaScript web apps.
*   [Micro (‚≠ê11k)](https://github.com/vercel/micro) - Minimalistic microservice framework with an async approach.
*   [LoopBack (‚≠ê5k)](https://github.com/loopbackio/loopback-next) - Powerful framework for creating REST APIs and easily connecting to backend data sources.
*   [TypeGraphQL (‚≠ê8.1k)](https://github.com/MichalLytek/type-graphql) - Modern framework for creating GraphQL APIs with TypeScript, using classes and decorators.
*   [Tinyhttp (‚≠ê2.8k)](https://github.com/tinyhttp/tinyhttp) - Modern and fast Express-like web framework.

### Packages / Documentation

*   [JSDoc (‚≠ê15k)](https://github.com/jsdoc/jsdoc) - API documentation generator similar to JavaDoc or PHPDoc.

### Packages / Filesystem

*   [proper-lockfile (‚≠ê254)](https://github.com/moxystudio/node-proper-lockfile) - Inter-process and inter-machine lockfile utility.

### Packages / Real-time

*   [¬µWebSockets (‚≠ê18k)](https://github.com/uNetworking/uWebSockets) - Highly scalable WebSocket server & client library.
*   [Aedes (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/moscajs/aedes) - Barebone MQTT server that can run on any stream server.

### Packages / URL

*   [humanize-url (‚≠ê248)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/humanize-url) - Humanize a URL: <https://sindresorhus.com> ‚Üí sindresorhus.com.

### Packages / Data validation

*   [joi (‚≠ê21k)](https://github.com/sideway/joi) - Object schema description language and validator for JavaScript objects.
*   [schema-inspector (‚≠ê504)](https://github.com/schema-inspector/schema-inspector) - JSON API sanitization and validation.
*   [ajv (‚≠ê14k)](https://github.com/ajv-validator/ajv) - The fastest JSON Schema validator. Supports v5, v6 and v7 proposals.

### Packages / Parsing

*   [remark (‚≠ê8.3k)](https://github.com/remarkjs/remark) - Markdown processor powered by plugins.
*   [x-ray (‚≠ê5.9k)](https://github.com/matthewmueller/x-ray) - Web scraping utility.
*   [nearley (‚≠ê3.7k)](https://github.com/kach/nearley) - Simple, fast, powerful parsing for JavaScript.
*   [google-libphonenumber (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/ruimarinho/google-libphonenumber) - Parse, format, store and validate phone numbers.

### Packages / Humanize

*   [ms (‚≠ê5.3k)](https://github.com/vercel/ms) - Tiny millisecond conversion utility.

### Packages / Database

*   Query builder
    *   [Knex (‚≠ê20k)](https://github.com/knex/knex) - Query builder for PostgreSQL, MySQL and SQLite3, designed to be flexible, portable, and fun to use.

### Packages / Testing

*   [nyc (‚≠ê5.7k)](https://github.com/istanbuljs/nyc) - Code coverage tool built on istanbul that works with subprocesses.
*   [tap (‚≠ê2.4k)](https://github.com/tapjs/node-tap) - TAP test framework.
*   [trevor (‚≠ê2.1k)](https://github.com/vadimdemedes/trevor) - Run tests against multiple versions of Node.js without switching versions manually or pushing to Travis CI.
*   [Nock (‚≠ê13k)](https://github.com/nock/nock) - HTTP mocking and expectations.
*   [CodeceptJS (‚≠ê4.2k)](https://github.com/codeceptjs/CodeceptJS) - End-to-end testing.
*   [Puppeteer (‚≠ê91k)](https://github.com/puppeteer/puppeteer) - Headless Chrome.

### Packages / Minifiers

*   [UglifyJS2 (‚≠ê13k)](https://github.com/mishoo/UglifyJS) - JavaScript minifier.
*   [clean-css (‚≠ê4.2k)](https://github.com/clean-css/clean-css) - CSS minifier.

### Packages / Email

*   [Nodemailer (‚≠ê17k)](https://github.com/nodemailer/nodemailer) - The fastest way to handle email.
*   [email-templates (‚≠ê3.7k)](https://github.com/forwardemail/email-templates) - Create, preview, and send custom email templates.

### Packages / Job queues

*   [agenda (‚≠ê9.5k)](https://github.com/agenda/agenda) - MongoDB-backed job scheduling.
*   [node-resque (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/actionhero/node-resque) - Redis-backed job queue.

### Packages / Natural language processing

*   [retext (‚≠ê2.4k)](https://github.com/retextjs/retext) - An extensible natural language system.

### Packages / AST

*   [Acorn (‚≠ê11k)](https://github.com/acornjs/acorn) - Tiny, fast JavaScript parser.

### Packages / Static site generators

*   [docsify (‚≠ê30k)](https://github.com/docsifyjs/docsify) - Markdown documentation site generator with no statically built HTML files.

### Packages / Content management systems

*   [Factor (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/FactorJS/factor) - Vue.js dashboard framework and headless CMS.
*   [AdminBro (‚≠ê8.6k)](https://github.com/SoftwareBrothers/adminjs) - Auto-generated admin panel with CRUD for all your resources.

### Packages / Serialization

*   [protobuf (‚≠ê10k)](https://github.com/protobufjs/protobuf.js) - Implementation of Protocol Buffers.

### Packages / Miscellaneous

*   [jsdom (‚≠ê21k)](https://github.com/jsdom/jsdom) - JavaScript implementation of HTML and the DOM.

### Resources / Tutorials

*   [Node.js Best Practices (‚≠ê103k)](https://github.com/goldbergyoni/nodebestpractices) - Summary and curation of the top-ranked content on Node.js best practices, available in multiple languages.
*   [Portable Node.js guide (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/ehmicky/cross-platform-node-guide) - Practical guide on how to write portable/cross-platform Node.js code.

### Resources / Newsletters

*   [Node Weekly](https://nodeweekly.com) - Weekly e-mail round-up of Node.js news and articles.

### Resources / Books

*   [Node.js in Practice](https://www.amazon.com/Node-js-Practice-Alex-R-Young/dp/1617290939)
*   [Mastering Node](https://visionmedia.github.io/masteringnode/)
*   [Node.js 8 the Right Way](https://pragprog.com/book/jwnode2/node-js-8-the-right-way/)
*   [Professional Node.js: Building JavaScript Based Scalable Software](https://www.amazon.com/Professional-Node-js-Building-Javascript-Scalable-ebook/dp/B009L7QETY/)
*   [Secure Your Node.js Web Application](https://www.amazon.com/Secure-Your-Node-js-Web-Application/dp/1680500856)

### Resources / Blogs

*   [webapplog.com](https://webapplog.com/tag/node-js/) - Blog posts on Node.js and JavaScript from the author of Practical Node.js and Pro Express.js Azat Mardan.

### Resources / Courses

*   [Real Time Web with Node.js](https://www.pluralsight.com/courses/code-school-real-time-web-with-nodejs)
*   [Learn and Understand Node.js](https://www.udemy.com/course/understand-nodejs/)

### Resources / Cheatsheets

*   [Express.js (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/azat-co/cheatsheets/tree/master/express4)

### Resources / Tools

*   [npm-hub](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/npmhub/kbbbjimdjbjclaebffknlabpogocablj) - Chrome extension to display npm dependencies at the bottom of a repo's readme.

### Resources / Community

*   [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/node.js)
*   [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/96WGtJt)

### Resources / Miscellaneous

*   [nodebots](https://nodebots.io) - Robots powered by JavaScript.
*   [Module Requests & Ideas (‚≠ê540)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/project-ideas) - Request a JavaScript module you wish existed or get ideas for modules.

items.title: Public Apis
items.content_text:
### Games & Comics

- API: [RPS 101](https://rps101.pythonanywhere.com/api)

  Description: Rock, Paper, Scissors with 101 objects

  Auth: No

  HTTPS: Yes

  CORS: Yes



### Geocoding

- API: [Apiip](https://apiip.net/)

  Description: Get location information by IP address

  Auth: `apiKey`

  HTTPS: Yes

  CORS: Yes



### Health

- API: [FoodData Central](https://fdc.nal.usda.gov/)

  Description: National Nutrient Database for Standard Reference

  Auth: `apiKey`

  HTTPS: Yes

  CORS: Unknown
items.content_html:
Games & Comics

  • API: RPS 101

    Description: Rock, Paper, Scissors with 101 objects

    Auth: No

    HTTPS: Yes

    CORS: Yes

Geocoding

  • API: Apiip

    Description: Get location information by IP address

    Auth: apiKey

    HTTPS: Yes

    CORS: Yes

Health

  • API: FoodData Central

    Description: National Nutrient Database for Standard Reference

    Auth: apiKey

    HTTPS: Yes

    CORS: Unknown

items.title: Awesome Zsh Plugins
items.content_text:
### Themes / [superconsole](https://github.com/alexchmykhalo/superconsole) - Windows-only

*   [flux (‚≠ê0)](https://github.com/jmg-duarte/flux-zsh) - A no-nonsense minimalist theme with `git` status decorations.
*   [linear (‚≠ê5)](https://github.com/MrYazdan/zsh-linear-theme) - Reminiscent of Powerline. Includes segments with `git` status, Pythonvirtualenv, current directory and current time.
*   [my (‚≠ê0)](https://github.com/fabiendelpierre/my-zsh-theme/) - Variant of [kolo (‚≠ê180k)](https://github.com/ohmyzsh/ohmyzsh/wiki/Themes#kolo).
items.content_html:
Themes / superconsole - Windows-only

  • flux (‚≠ê0) - A no-nonsense minimalist theme with git status decorations.
  • linear (‚≠ê5) - Reminiscent of Powerline. Includes segments with git status, Pythonvirtualenv, current directory and current time.
  • my (‚≠ê0) - Variant of kolo (‚≠ê180k).

items.title: Awesome Geek Podcasts
items.content_text:
### In English

*   [Watch Out for Fireballs!](https://www.watchoutforfireballs.com/) - A game club podcast, focused on retro and non-current games.

### In Portuguese

*   [Podtrash](http://www.td1p.com/) - Um podcast sobre filmes trash, feito por adoradores do trash.
items.content_html:
In English

  • Watch Out for Fireballs! - A game club podcast, focused on retro and non-current games.

In Portuguese

  • Podtrash - Um podcast sobre filmes trash, feito por adoradores do trash.
